articles.title: Canadian Government Accused of Taking Issue with DPRK's Just Judgment
articles.content:
Canadian Government Accused of Taking Issue with DPRK's Just Judgment
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to the question raised by KCNA Tuesday as regards the fact that Canada is taking issue with the entirely just judgment made by a judicial organ of the DPRK:
					 The prime minister and other official figures of Canada are recklessly spouting rubbish against the DPRK over the judgment its Supreme Court made by giving the penalty of life hard labor to Rim Hyon Su, a Canadian citizen, on Dec. 16.
					
					 Rim was arrested while being involved in a thrice-cursed subversion plot against the DPRK, pursuant to the U.S. and the south Korean authorities' hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 It is very shocking that the Canadian government is accusing the DPRK of its fair and square judgment, describing it as violation of international law that provokes concerns, far from feeling guilty about the hideous crime committed by Rim.
					
					 It is explicitly specified in the Vienna Convention on Consular Relations that the right to contact a consulate should be exercised in compliance with laws and regulations of the country of its residence.
					
					 During the period of investigation into Rim we did not allow him to meet an official looking after consular affairs under the law of the DPRK. But after the investigation we invited a Canadian delegation as an exception and allowed its members to take part in the trial as observers and also let Rim contact a consulate.
					
					 So the Canadian government has no legal justifications whatsoever to find fault with the DPRK.
					
					 The government is obliged to make an apology for the hideous anti-DPRK crimes acknowledged by him and take steps for the prevention of the recurrence of similar case. However, it shielded Rim and pointed an accusing finger at the DPRK just like a thief crying "Stop the thief". We can never remain an on-looker to it.
					
					 The Canadian side's unreasonable and uncouth response would only render the situation more complicated.
					
					 Now the Korean people are demanding heavier punishment on Rim, hardly repressing their indignation at his crimes.
					
					 It should be understood that the law of the DPRK punishes whoever harbors hostile feelings toward the ideology and social system of the country and whoever is set to undermine them.

articles.title: DPRK FM Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
articles.content:
DPRK FM Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Ri Kil Song left here on Tuesday to visit Mongolia.

articles.title: Sinuiju-River Amnok Tourist Zone of DPRK Opened to Visitors
articles.content:
Sinuiju-River Amnok Tourist Zone of DPRK Opened to Visitors
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The Sinuiju-River Amnok tourist zone in the DPRK was opened to visitors with due ceremony on Sunday.
					 The zone, developed in the shore of the River Amnok jointly by the Korea Myohyangsan Travel Company and the Dandong International Travel Agency of China, has modern all-round service facilities.
					
					 Present at its opening ceremony were Ri Ung Chol, deputy director-general of the State General Bureau of Tourism, and other officials concerned of the DPRK and officials concerned and tourists from China.
					
					 An inauguration address and a congratulatory speech were made at the ceremony before cutting the tape for the completion of the tourist zone.
					
					 Then its participants went round the zone.

articles.title: Some Food and Products Considered Best in DPRK
articles.content:
Some Food and Products Considered Best in DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- 18 foods and products liked by people most were chosen to be the 2015 best and awarded December 15 medals of quality in the DPRK.
					 Typical foods include fruit-flavored bread, marmalade and Koryo liquor and products include hard glassware and brass kitchenware. 
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture Tuesday.

articles.title: Art Performance Given by Workers' Art Group of C.C., GFTUK
articles.content:
Art Performance Given by Workers' Art Group of C.C., GFTUK
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- An art performance was given by the Workers' Art Group of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea at the Cultural Hall of the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex on Tuesday on the occasion of December 24.
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers praising the revolutionary feats of leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 In the mixed chorus "Our General Is the Best" and dialogic poem "Blessing of Having Supreme Commanders" the performers sang high praises of the great personality of Kim Jong Il who developed the People's Army into the one strong in ideology and faith and an invincible powerful army and demonstrated the might of Kim Il Sung's Korea to the world with the invincible military capabilities.
					
					 The repertoire included numbers recollecting the revolutionary life of Kim Jong Suk who glorified her whole life in devotedly defending the leader and gave a steady continuity to the lineage of Kim Il Sung's nation.
					
					 Also put on the stage were numbers representing ardent reverence for Marshal Kim Jong Un and showing the noble spiritual world of workers and other members of the GFTUK.
					
					 Among the audience were Ri Il Hwan, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ju Yong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the GFTUK, and its officials and workers in the city.

articles.title: Film Show Arranged for Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Film Show Arranged for Military Attaches Corps 
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of the People's Armed Forces arranged a film show for the military attaches corps here Tuesday on the occasion of the 24th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the corps.
					
					 Officers of the Korean People's Army attended.
					
					 The participants watched Korean documentary film "At Outposts Standing Guard over the Country", part 2 "General Kim Jong Il, Peerless Patriot".

articles.title: Young Runners Pass through Kangwon Province
articles.content:
Young Runners Pass through Kangwon Province
 Wonsan, December 22 (KCNA) -- Loyal members of the relay group of young vanguard passed through Kangwon Province, flying a red flag in their van.
					 They arrived at Pobtong County, Kangwon Province on Dec. 14, where they were greeted by officials concerned, people from all walks of life and school youths and children.
					
					 The red flag was handed over to a relay group of the province at Sangso-ri, Pobtong County.
					
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets and made bows before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in Wonsan City and the Songdowon International Children's Camp, the statue of the President at Hero Munchon Senior Secondary School in Munchon City and the mosaics depicting the smiling peerlessly great men and their images in various historical places.
					
					 On Chol Pass they looked back upon the leadership feats of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 They visited the Ryongpho Revolutionary Site associated with the exploits the President performed by leading the Fatherland Liberation War to a victory, and toured Wonsan University of Agriculture, Munphyong Smeltery, Wonsan Youth Power Station and Chonsam Co-op Farm in Anbyon County.
					
					 They also toured the Songdowon International Children's Camp, Wonsan Baby Home and Orphanage.
					
					 They joined youths and students in Kangwon Province in holding an oath-taking meeting.
					
					 They held a meeting at Anbyon County to renew their pledge to annihilate the U.S. imperialists and their followers if they dare provoke a war.
					
					 During the journey they did various political and cultural activities such as hearing impressions of the reminiscences of anti-Japanese guerillas read by them and holding an oratorical meeting.

articles.title: Foreign Women Here Visit Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
articles.content:
Foreign Women Here Visit Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Women of foreign embassies and missions of international organizations here visited Mangyongdae Revolutionary School on Tuesday on the occasion of the 98th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 They laid floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the school and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Being briefed on the history covered by the school under the care of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and the fact that children are being brought up to be core members who would carry forward the lineage of the Korean revolution, they looked round the room devoted to the education in revolutionary relics, lecture rooms, etc.

articles.title: Sci-Tech Complex in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Sci-Tech Complex in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The Sci-Tech Complex has taken its shape on scenic Ssuk Islet in the River Taedong, displaying the stamina of the DPRK which dashes toward the high eminence of a technology power.
					 The atomic-structure-shaped complex, with a total floor space of 106 600 square meters, is a center for disseminating the modern sci-tech knowledge and information.
					
					 Its lighting and air-conditioning systems are based on solar, geothermal and other natural energies.
					
					 The complex serves as an e-library which stores in an overall and systematic way the sci-tech books and latest sci-tech achievements published or made in the DPRK as well as advanced sci-tech data from other countries. It is able to render real-time services to scientific institutes, educational institutions, industrial establishments and homes in the country through a national computer network.
					
					 It has also various kinds of sci-tech exhibition halls and sci-tech rooms equipped with touch computers, projectors and other up-to-date equipment to help its visitors grasp the principles and methods of science and technology.
					
					 Besides, on the islet there are a hotel for scientists with a capacity of 500 beds, an open-air study site, a fountain park, a tower symbolizing science and technology and a trolley-bus stop.

articles.title: Red Bean with Long History of Cultivation in Korea
articles.content:
Red Bean with Long History of Cultivation in Korea
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Red bean is one of crops widely cultivated in Korea from olden times.
					 It can be well evidenced by red beans unearthed at an archeological site dating back to the Bronze Age in Hoeryong, North Hamgyong Province.
					
					 Red bean has been considered to be a fine health food as it is rich in different nutritious ingredients like protein, carbohydrate and Vitamin B1.
					
					 Carried in "Tongguksesigi" and other old books is a method of making rice gruel with mashed red bean, a special diet for the winter solstice day.
					
					 This year, the winter solstice day falls on December 22.

articles.title: Minju Joson Discloses Grave Human Rights Situation in U.S.
articles.content:
Minju Joson Discloses Grave Human Rights Situation in U.S.
Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A U.S. website recently reported about the wide gap between the rich and the poor in the U.S. According to it, the property of 20 billionaires is much bigger than that of 152 million people. There are also huge racial divides in the economic field. It was reported that the property of the richest 100 families in America is much bigger than that of all the African-Americans. 
					 This is the present situation of human rights in the U.S. which calls for "welfare for all" and "equality for all," Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary. 
					
					 It is axiomatic for those who find it hard to sustain themselves with scanty finance not to discuss dignity, creative life and hope and dream for the future as an independent human being, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 That is why a lot of hopeless and helpless Americans opt for alcohol and drugs, finally committing crimes and even suicide. No wonder people call the U.S. heaven for the rich and hell for the poor. 
					
					 In a word, the "protection of human rights" and "freedom" advocated by the U.S. are not for the majority of the toiling masses but for a handful of the privileged. 
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that the U.S. is causing human rights mayhem worldwide while crying out for the "protection of human rights" despite its grave human rights performance. 
					
					 In disregard of international law the U.S. has unhesitatingly launched military aggression of sovereign countries, killed a lot of innocent people, indiscriminately wire-tapped heads of state and resorted to shuddering human rights abuses in secret prisons overseas.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Support Mass Campaign in S. Korea
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Support Mass Campaign in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. staged a demonstration in Los Angeles and Washington on Dec. 18 and 19 in solidarity with the third all-out mass campaign in south Korea.
					 The demonstrators extended support and solidarity to the campaign of south Koreans against the unpopular rule by the south Korean regime that took power through rigging in the 2012 election.
					
					 Sniping at Park Geun Hye for masterminding the illegal election to become president, they demanded her regime's resignation.
					
					 They chanted slogans calling for a proper probe into the truth behind the Ferry Sewol disaster, south Korean regime's retraction of its plan to introduce "state-compiled history textbooks" and stop to its retrogressive revision of the labor law and unreasonable suppression under the pretext of security.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Accused of Labeling Peaceful Rally as "Illegal One"
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Accused of Labeling Peaceful Rally as "Illegal One"
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore in an editorial on Dec. 21 denounced the conservative group for getting frantic in crackdown on the participants in the 3rd all-out people's action.
					 The editorial recalled that there took place in a peaceful way the 3rd all-out people's action in different parts of south Korea including Seoul on Dec. 19. It said:
					
					 But the police claimed that the rally changed into a "politically-motivated rally". It is absurd that the police declared that it would take a legal action against the sponsor side and participants on charges of violation of the "law on rally and demonstration".

articles.title: Results of Investigation into U.S. Introduction of Anthrax Rejected
articles.content:
Results of Investigation into U.S. Introduction of Anthrax Rejected
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- An editorial rejecting the result of investigation by the joint group into the case of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces' introduction of anthrax into south Korea was posted on Voice of People, the internet newspaper of south Korea, on Dec. 21.
					 The editorial recalled that the south Korea-U.S. joint group released the result of investigation into the case on Dec. 17.
					
					 It said that missing in the results were contents such as what experiments and drills the U.S. forces conducted with such dangerous substances as anthrax.
					
					 The joint group made recommendations replacing the revision of south Korea-U.S. "State of Forces Agreement" as a measure for preventing the recurrence of the case, a little short of conniving at and glossing over the crimes of the U.S. forces, it said.

articles.title: U.S. Forces in S. Korea Urged to Go Home with Anthrax, Pest
articles.content:
U.S. Forces in S. Korea Urged to Go Home with Anthrax, Pest
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- An editorial titled "U.S. forces, go home with anthrax, pest" was posted on Minjok Ilbo, an internet newspaper of south Korea, on Dec. 18.
					 The U.S. forces conducted experiments on anthrax in Osan and Ryongsan and there are such labs in Phyongthaek and Kunsan, it noted.
					
					 Bio-chemical weapons are a war means for which the U.S. counts much along with nuclear weapons, it said, condemning the U.S. for having already used bio-chemical weapons in the past Korean war.
					
					 Calling for abrogating the unequal south Korea-U.S. SOFA and bringing the U.S. president to an international tribunal, the editorial said the most evident measure for preventing the recurrence is for the U.S. to go home.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Highly Praised by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Highly Praised by Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A memorial event of organizations of Koreans in China took place in Yanji City, China on December 17, the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were officials of the Yanbian Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China, and those of various branches under the regional association, those and members of the Yanbian Regional Association of the Federation of Korean Young Nationals in China and other Koreans in China.
					
					 The participants laid bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to them.
					
					 Speakers at a meeting said Kim Jong Il performed great exploits before the era and history with total dedication to the happiness of the people and prosperity of the country.
					
					 A letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event.
					
					 The participants watched a film dealing with the revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Letter Reported by TASS
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Letter Reported by TASS
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The gist of "Let Us Dynamically Accelerate the Building of a Thriving Nation by Bringing about a Turn in Financial and Banking Work", the letter sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un to the participants in the 3rd National Conference of Financial and Banking Officials, was reported by TASS on December 14.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered by Foreigners
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered by Foreigners
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held by the Romanian national committee for remembering General Secretary Kim Jong Il and at Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia, Bulgaria and a Malaysian company on Dec. 8 and 9 on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at the venues of the meetings were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and picture albums introducing the DPRK. 
					
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Socialist Party of Romania who doubles as chairman of the Romanian national committee, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was the great leader of the Korean people who dedicated all his life to the prosperity of the country and well-being of its people.
					
					 We are recollecting him with deep emotion on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of his demise.
					
					 We will keep in mind his personality as a great man and undying exploits.
					
					 The acting chief of Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia and other speakers spoke highly of his noble revolutionary career and brilliant exploits.
					
					 They noted his great exploits for the Korean people and the world progressives will be handed down in history.
					
					 A message to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting held in Bulgaria.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary Observed by Foreign Parties
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary Observed by Foreign Parties 
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held by the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia and the Communist Party of Tajikistan and a remembrance meeting by the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party on Dec. 14 on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Sazhi Umalatova, chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, praised Kim Jong Il as the father of the people as he regarded it as his motto to believe in the people as in Heaven and devoted his life to the people. 
					
					 Ivan Shashbiashbili, vice-chairman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, said Kim Jong Il showed in practice what an important role an outstanding state leader plays in the present time.
					
					 The vice-chairman noted Kim Jong Il bolstered up the national military capabilities as the supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, adding this was his great exploit.
					
					 Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, noted Kim Jong Il devoted his whole life to defending the independent dignity of the country and bringing happiness to the Korean people.
					
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party, praised Kim Jong Il as a great man revered by progressive mankind as well as the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Algerian Reporter
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Algerian Reporter
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The correspondent (Algerian) of the Saudi Press Agency in Algeria, posted on his website an article titled "I pay highest tribute to HE leader Kim Jong Il on 4th anniversary of his demise" on Dec. 13.
					 I highly laud Kim Jong Il as the world great man as he dedicated his all to the people and added shine to history to be warmly admired by the people, the author said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il's career was characterized by firm maintenance of the principle of valuing tomorrow more than today.
					
					 He always looked far into the future and gave priority to the future of the country when shaping a single line and policy and handling any problem in the whole course of leading the country and people.
					
					 Herein lie his traits as an outstanding great man.
					
					 His whole life was the one of noble devotion by which he dedicated his all to the country and people.
					
					 The Korean people and world peace-loving people will always recollect him who dedicated his whole life to the country and people and the development of the friendly and cooperative relations among countries.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Malabo, Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Malabo, Equatorial Guinea
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Party and the government of Equatorial Guinea separately sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Malabo on December 15 on the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The director of the Secretariat of the secretary general's office who is leading a delegation of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea and the general director for Asia who is leading a delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation of Equatorial Guinea laid floral baskets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK Will Demonstrate to World Its Mightiness: Political Figure of DR Congo
articles.content:
DPRK Will Demonstrate to World Its Mightiness: Political Figure of DR Congo 
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Jimmy Kikoni, general secretary of the Workers' Party of DR Congo, issued a statement on Dec. 9 on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 He said that Kim Jong Il met big challenges lying in the road of socialist Korea and turned the DPRK into a political and military power with self-supporting economy under the uplifted banner of independence against imperialism.
					
					 The successes made by the Korean people under his leadership clearly prove the vitality and validity of the Juche idea which helps solve all the problems by their own efforts in conformity with the situation of the country while taking the position of master in the revolution and construction and firmly adhering to independence and creativity, the general secretary noted, adding:
					
					 The Workers' Party of DR Congo and its people expressed their admiration at the DPRK government firmly preserving the guiding principles for political sovereignty, self-supporting economy and national capabilities for self-defence.
					
					 We praise Kim Jong Il for achieving the unity and cohesion of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 The DPRK will always emerge victorious and demonstrate its mightiness to the world, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il, as long as Marshal Kim Jong Un is carrying forward the cause of Juche in the van of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy from Cambodian King, Great Queen
articles.content:
Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy from Cambodian King, Great Queen
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni and Great Queen Norodom Monineath Sihanouk separately sent large floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh on Dec. 17, the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 Upon the authorization of the king and the queen, a delegation of the Cambodian Ministry of Royal Palace led by Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister for Royal Palace and chairman of the Cambodian committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, laid the floral baskets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The head of the delegation praised Kim Jong Il for performing immortal feats for the development of friendly relations between the two countries and wished him immortality. 
					
					 He wished the Korean people greater success in their efforts to build a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: MINREX de RPDC acusa a Canada que censura sentencia justa de organo judicial
articles.content:
MINREX de RPDC acusa a Canada que censura sentencia justa de organo judicial 
Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En relacion con que Canada censura una sentencia justa del organo judicial de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio el dia 22  a la pregunta formulada por la ACNC la siguiente respuesta:
					El pasado dia 16, el Tribunal Supremo de la RPDC sentencio una pena perpetua de trabajo reeducativo al ciudadano canadiense Rim Hyon Su quien cometio los actos de derrocamiento de la RPDC siguiendo a ciegas a la politica anti-RPDC de Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas. Al respecto, el premier canadiense y otras personalidades oficiales desacreditan sin ton ni son a la RPDC.
					
					Estamos tan espantados ante el hecho de que el gobierno canadiense, que se encuentra en estado delictivo por tal criminalidad de su ciudadano, se atreve a censurar nuestra justa medida judicial calificandola de "medida preocupante" y "violacion de ley internacional".
					
					En la Convencion Viena sobre Relaciones Consulares, esta estipulado claramente el contenido de que el derecho de contacto consular debe ser realizado conforme a las leyes y reglas de pais de residencia.
					
					Ateniendonos a nuestra ley, no permitimos el contacto consular durante el proceso de pesquisa sobre el acusado, pero, terminada la inquisicion, invitamos excepcionalmente la delegacion canadiense al juicio en calidad de observador e hicimos que esta realizara un contacto consular con el detenido.
					
					Por lo tanto, el gobierno canadiense no tiene ninguna razon judicial para acusar nuestra medida.
					
					No podemos tolerar jamas el hecho de que en vez de pedir disculpas por el acto criminal anti-RPDC reconocido por el detenido Rim y tomar las medidas para la prevencion de la repeticion de los casos similares, el gobierno canadiense lo ampara y nos censura astutamente al igual que el incendiario grita primero "!fuego!"
					
					El proceder injusto e insolente de la parte canadiense complica mas la situacion.
					
					Ahora, el pueblo coreano esta indignado ante la criminalidad de Rim y demanda darle castigo mas duro.
					
					Debe darse clara cuenta de que la ley de la RPDC castigara duramente a quienes tratan de hostilizar la idea y el sistema social de ella y derrumbarla.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de cancilleria coreana
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de cancilleria coreana
Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Salio hoy de esta capital la delegacion del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por su viceministro Ri Kil Song para realizar una visita a Mongolia.

articles.title: Abierta zona turistica Sinuiju-rio Amnok
articles.content:
Abierta zona turistica Sinuiju-rio Amnok 
Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Quedo abierta la zona turistica Sinuiju-rio Amnok con todas las facilidades modernas de servicio gracias a la cooperacion entre la Agencia del Turismo Myohyangsan de Corea y la Agencia del Turismo Internacional Dandong de China.
					Tuvo lugar el dia 20 la ceremonia de su inauguracion.
					
					Participaron alli Ri Ung Chol, subdirector general de la Direccion Estatal de Turismo, y otros funcionarios, los relacionados y turistas de la parte china.
					
					Hubo las palabras inaugurales y discurso de felicitacion.
					
					Tras cortar una cinta de inauguracion, los participantes recorrieron la zona.
